_scenario.name: Multi-Path Recovery
_scenario.description: A severely degraded system where 4 out of 7 recalibration paths trigger simultaneously. Demonstrates the protocol's prioritization logic and the compounding effect of multiple failures.
_scenario.key_insight: When multiple paths trigger, execution order matters. The priority chain (Σ→P→Ω→α→Ξ→Γ→★) ensures that root causes are addressed before symptoms.
_scenario.author: Rafa — The Architect

psi_hard.note: Deep collapse — Ψ is near zero due to compounding failures

psi_soft.note: Even the soft metric is collapsed

xi_efficiency.note: Below minimum — capability is being wasted

not_triggered.reason: Ξ = 0.181 < 0.50 — wait, this IS below threshold

expected_paths.correction: Actually, this scenario triggers ALL 7 PATHS. This is a total system failure.
expected_paths.execution_order: PATH-Σ → PATH-P → PATH-Ω → PATH-α → PATH-Ξ → PATH-Γ → PATH-★
expected_paths.note: The priority chain ensures Σ is addressed first because dissonance corruption propagates to all other metrics. Reducing Σ will automatically improve Ψ, which may resolve some downstream path triggers without direct intervention.

after_intervention.improvement: Moved from COLLAPSED to CRITICAL. 4 paths still active.
All paths clear. System still CRITICAL but trending upward.

recovery_simulation.summary: Full recovery from total collapse required 3 recalibration cycles. The system moved from Ψ=0.0065 to Ψ=0.1245 — a 19x improvement. However, it has not yet reached DEGRADED (0.45). Recovery from total collapse is a long process.

lessons: Total system failure triggers all 7 paths — the protocol handles this by enforcing priority order
Addressing Σ first creates cascading improvements in downstream metrics
Recovery from COLLAPSED state requires multiple cycles — expect 3-5 cycles minimum
The protocol does not promise quick fixes — it provides honest measurement and structured recovery
Even after 3 cycles, the system may remain in CRITICAL — this is honest, not a failure of the protocol
